title: The 'secret signals' the Queen uses to let staff know what she’s thinking in public
text:

The Queen has an enviable array of outfits to choose from. 
But it turns out the handbags and jewellery aren't just for show. 
The trusty black Launer bag that the monarch is frequently pictured carrying has a practical purpose, according to those in the know. 
Royal historian Hugo Vickers claims the Queen uses the handbag to send secret signals to her staff. Read More This is the Queen's favourite breakfast cereal The Queen is claimed to use her handbag to relay discreet messages (Photo: Getty Images Europe) 
A shift of the bag from one hand to another is an indication she is ready to move on from whoever she is speaking to, he claimed. 
Placing the bag on a table means she is ready to leave an event. 
Her wedding ring, too, has a function - with a discreet twist notifying royal officials she would like to end a conversation quickly. Read More The Queen uses her handbag to tell staff when she wants to move on (Photo: Getty Images Europe) 
A more dramatic spin of the ring means she is particularly keen to leave. 
Vickers told People : "Luckily, they’d let you down easy.' 
"It would be done very nicely. Someone would come along and say, "'ir, the Archbishop of Canterbury would very much like to meet you'." Read More The Royal family's body language secrets revealed - including the Queen's 'Miss Piggy Face' The Queen is also said to use her wedding ring to relay messages to staff (Photo: Tim Graham Photo Library) 
While at Buckingham Palace the Queen is said to have the use of a hidden buzzer that indicates staff should open doors and escort the person she is speaking to out. 
It it is not just Her Royal Highness that employs subtle strategies to spare them getting stuck too long talking to the same person. The Duke of Edinburgh also has secret tricks (Photo: PA) 
Prince Philip is known to employ a sweeping motion when meeting people in a lineup to avoid getting embroiled in a lengthy chat. 
The Duchess of Cambridge often carries a clutch bag in front of her - and is suggested to use it to avoid having to shake hands at awkward moments. 
And Vickers added: “What they all do is try to find a quick joke to leave it on. Prince Charles has a quick ‘ha ha’ and that enables him to break the conversation.” Like us on Facebook
